Description: Fecal coliforms indicate the presence of pathogens in water which may impose health risk like dysentery, typhoid fever, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain
Advice: Boil this water before consumption or use household bleach or use tablets like water guard before consumption or vigorously shake the small amount of water in the transparent container like such of soft drink and expose it to sunlight for at least 6 hours before consumption

Problem identified: Nitrate, sodium, Fecal coliforms and total coliforms
Description: Fecal coliforms indicate the presence of pathogens in water which may impose health risk like dysentery, typhoid fever, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain. High nitrate levels can lead blue-baby syndrome in infants. High sodium may cause taste of water be affected
Advice: Boil this water before consumption or use household bleach or use tablets like water guard before consumption or vigorously shake the small amount of water in the transparent container like such of soft drink and expose it to sunlight for at least 6 hours before consumption. Nitrate can be reduced through ion exchange. Sodium can be reduced through distillation, ion exchange and reverse osmosis
